description.plain: Omari Ishmael Grandberry is an American R&B singer, actor, songwriter, record producer, dancer, and former lead singer of R&B group B2K. In 2012, he signed with Maybach Music Group and took on the nickname Maybach O.

body.plain: Omari Ishmael Grandberry is an American R&B singer, actor, songwriter, record producer, dancer, and former lead singer of R&B group B2K. In 2012, he signed with Maybach Music Group and took on the nickname Maybach O.

songs.full_title: Post to Be by Omarion (Ft. Chris Brown & Jhené Aiko)
songs.title: Post to Be
songs.title_with_featured: Post to Be (Ft. Chris Brown & Jhené Aiko)

description.plain:
“Post to Be” is the second single from Omarion’s fourth studio album Sex Playlist, released via MMG.

The lyrics capitalize on a loose interpretation of the word “post,” which usually means to send (as in mail) or to stand (as in a bed post, or a basketball center “posted up” in the paint). In this song the word is used onomatopoeically – “post” sounds like “‘pose,” short for “supposed”.

songs.embed_content: Read “Post to Be” by Omarion on Genius

body.plain:
“Post to Be” is the second single from Omarion’s fourth studio album Sex Playlist, released via MMG.

The lyrics capitalize on a loose interpretation of the word “post,” which usually means to send (as in mail) or to stand (as in a bed post, or a basketball center “posted up” in the paint). In this song the word is used onomatopoeically – “post” sounds like “‘pose,” short for “supposed”.

songs.title: M.I.A.

description.plain:
Sadly, not a song about this M.I.A.:



On a site where four-year gaps between features isn’t unheard of, six months M.I.A. is barely a blip on the radar. Still, with no fresh material from Omarion since this past May, fans of the Maybach crooner must be getting mighty hungry. While this cut doesn’t exactly qualify as new, having been included on Self Made Vol. 2 back in June, the release of its official video provides the perfect opportunity to get Omarion back on our front page. To complement the record, a breakup ballad featuring production by The Beat Bully and guest rhymes by labelmate Wale, director Topshelf Jr. creates a seamy domestic drama in miniature. Feeling it? You can still cop the record as part of MMG‘s compilation.

songs.embed_content: Read “M.I.A.” by Omarion on Genius

To complement the record, a breakup ballad featuring production by The Beat Bully and guest rhymes by labelmate Wale, director Topshelf Jr. creates a seamy domestic drama in miniature. Feeling it? description.plain:
This track is a remix to the hit single “Post To Be”, which features Chris Brown and Jhené Aiko. The remix also includes big names, with DeJ Loaf, Ty Dolla $ign, Trey Songz and Rick Ross assisting.

The song was taken down on Spotify and other streaming platforms due to the MMG feud in which Meek Mill got dropped by Rick Ross.
